content: Act as an intelligence analyst, your task is to generate a summary of the interaction logs of a user who was trying to investigate an event in the intelligence domain. The logs are written in sentences. The entire interaction is divided into 11 segments. You will be summarizing the entire interaction session step by step by summarizing one segment at a time. When you are summarizing a segment, make sure you take into account summaries of previous segments. Please summarize a segment in at most 100 words. The goal is to communicate findings and progress in a collaborative investigation scenario. Here's an EXAMPLE (delimited by triple backticks) of the summarization for an overall interaction session. EXAMPLE: ```This session began by searching for the word "Nigeria" and looking at the documents returned. They noted that Dr. George and Mikhail emailed and then transitioned to searches about "Kenya" and the Middle East. At this time, they were reviewing people like Leonid Minsky and Anna Nicole Smith. By the end of the session, they had transitioned to exploring documents from Russia and middle eastern countries. They searched for "death," "kasem" and "dubai." In the end, they returned to some of the same documents they had opened at the beginning but also opened many different documents for the first time. Out of the 46 topics and 102 documents, they reviewed 39 topics, opened 45% of the total documents at least once, and spent an average of 30 seconds with each document. The people they returned to most frequently were Leonid Minsky, Mikhail Dombrovski, and Dr. George.```

Summarize the sentences describing the interactions of segment 1 delimited by triple backticks in at most 100 words. Make sure you take into account summaries of previous segments. Description: ```The user thought aloud So the diseas was startet in Nigeria in Feb 2011. then spreaded to ..reading all countries.., thought aloud Do we know to name of the disease or it;s just an infection disease?, thought aloud I'm thinking it's better to starting with the disease to figure out what the disease is first or tto figure out what happend in the Nigeria first. Like how the disease startet in Nigeria, thought aloud I think I would go with the figuring out what the disease is and then try to find out what all about arms dealing that was happening in these countries and see if they took the disease somehow, searched for disease, changed topic  (Looking for causes of the disease) (type 1) [top-down], mouse hovered over armsdealing97, dragged over document armsdealing97, dragged over document armsdealing98, searched for Nigeria, mouse hovered over armsdealing31, thought aloud Ok so I'm going to start reading about Nigeria and see what happened in Nigeria in the first place, mouse hovered over armsdealing79, dragged over document armsdealing79, thought aloud opening the first document, opened document armsdealing79, read document armsdealing79, thought aloud this is an email from US government, thought aloud No that not from the US governent. It is from an engineer, read document armsdealing79, thought aloud He is talking about the deal he wants to do with the department if energy, thought aloud I'm trying to see if it's actually related to the department of energy and nothing else. they might talk about energy to hide the talks about illigal weapons and stuff like that, thought aloud It say's that a forign company was involved with the deal when they were sending the money, thought aloud [still readung the first document], highlighted FUNSHO KAPOLALUM in document armsdealing79, read document armsdealing79, opened document armsdealing79, thought aloud [asking how to close the document but keep the highlight part], opened document armsdealing79, opened document armsdealing79, opened document armsdealing79, opened document armsdealing79, read document armsdealing79, dragged over document armsdealing79, mouse hovered over armsdealing81, dragged over document armsdealing81, thought aloud opening and reading the second document, opened document armsdealing81, read document armsdealing81, dragged over document armsdealing81, thought aloud I'm reading another email boyo.. actually that's the same guy because the email addresses are the same, read document armsdealing81, read document armsdealing81, thought aloud Still reading the same document, thought aloud Still reading the same document, dragged over document armsdealing79, read document armsdealing81, thought aloud Still reading the same document, searched for gun, changed topic  (Looking for Gun dealers in Nigeria and Kenya) (type 2)[bottom-up], read document armsdealing81, dragged over document armsdealing81, dragged over document armsdealing97, opened document armsdealing97, read document armsdealing97, dragged over document armsdealing79, dragged over document armsdealing81, read document armsdealing97, read document armsdealing97, thought aloud i'm reading from a blog It about Africa socaitiy, highlighted Kenya in document armsdealing97, read document armsdealing97, thought aloud I see several people were arrested in Keniya by the land defense police but I don't know why. oh yeah they have been covered 150 guns!, highlighted Also recovered were 150 guns in document armsdealing97, read document armsdealing97, thought aloud So now I want to figure out were thse gus were coming from. Nigeria or . , thought aloud Still reading the documents, read document armsdealing97, searched for nigeria, searched for gun, read document armsdealing97, dragged over document armsdealing97, thought aloud moves old document aside, dragged over document armsdealing98, opened document armsdealing98, read document armsdealing98, thought aloud Picks a new gun document and starts reading, thought aloud It's a blog wrriting and it's about Kenya too, searched for nigeria,```
